Prerequisites: PREREQUISITE(S):  ACG 3103 WITH A MINIMUM GRADE OF B AND ISM 3011 WITH A MINIMUM GRADE OF C
Course Description: PRIMARY PROCESSES, OR CYCLES, OF ORGANIZATIONS; DOCUMENTATION OF BUSINESS PROCESSES; AND THE RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH EACH EVENT IN THE PROCESSES. EMPHASIS IS PLACED ON CONTROLLING RISKS AND MINIMIZING THE POTENTIAL IMPACT THEY HAVE ON BUSINESSES. TOPICS INCLUDE TRANSACTION CYCLES, FRAUD AND INTERNAL CONTROLS, AND RELATIONAL DATABASE STRUCTURE.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
DEMONSTRATE KNOWLEDGE OF RISK
MANAGEMENT TECHNIQUES AS THEY APPLY
TO ACCOUNTING 
DEMONSTRATE KNOWLEDGE OF ETHICAL
ISSUES AS THEY APPLY TO ACCOUNTING
ANALYZE ACCOUNTING PROBLEMS THAT
CONCERN ACCOUNTING PRACTICE AREAS
INTERPRET THE RELEVANCE OF INFORMATION
COMMUNICATE RELIABLE INFORMATION
APPLY ACCOUNTING THEORIES/STANDARDS TO
ACCOUNTING PRACTICE AREAS 
HAVE KNOWLEDGE OF ALL BUSINESS AREAS OF
STUDY
